Method Detail

propertiesFileExists

public static boolean propertiesFileExists()
Check whether the properties file already exists

Returns:
true if the properties file already exists, false otherwise.

isPropertiesFileVersionCurrent

public static boolean isPropertiesFileVersionCurrent(java.util.Properties appProperties)
Check whether the Properties file is at current version

Parameters:
appProperties - Properties object
Returns:
true if the Properties file is at current version, false otherwise. Please note that this function will return true if the file does not exist, since a new AppProperties object will be created and tested for its version.

areAllPropertiesSet

public static boolean areAllPropertiesSet(java.util.Properties appProperties)
Check whether all Properties in the file are set.

Returns:
true if all Properties in the file are set, false otherwise.

readPropertiesFromFile

public static java.util.Properties readPropertiesFromFile()
Read the properties from disk

Returns:
a Properties object or null if it could not be loaded

writePropertiesToFile

public static boolean writePropertiesToFile(java.lang.String openBISURL,
                                            java.lang.String acceptSelfSignedCerts,
                                            java.lang.String acqStation,
                                            java.lang.String userDataDir,
                                            java.lang.String incomingDir)
Write the properties to disk

Returns:
true if the properties were saved successfully, false otherwise This function might require write access to a restricted system folder. It should be used only in code run with admin privileges.

initializePropertiesFile

public static java.util.Properties initializePropertiesFile()
Initialize the properties file (if it does not exist)

Returns:
the generated Properties object or null if it could not be saved to disk. This function might require write access to a restricted system folder. It should be used only in code run with admin privileges.
